cypherfox wrote:

> Sure, making tests completely independant is great if you're
> not testing against anything ELSE that has state, but if you
> are, you need to be able to retain something, a session id, a
> message id, the connection to the server, etc.

No - you need to be able to put the thing with state you are testing
against into a known state before each single test. Sometimes you can do
this simply by setting creating the state in setUp(), sometimes it's
better to replace you test against with something you have more control
over (that is, mock it). After all, you want to test the classes which
use the server, not the server itself, don't you?

Cheers, Ilja
